person.persName: Ulysses Simpson Grant (U.S. General and President)

body.p: Ohio, commander of the Union armies. Point Pleasant, Ohio native. Born Hiram Ulysses Grant. Son of Jesse Root Grant and Hannah Simpson. Married to Julia Boggs Dent in 1848. Father of Frederick Grant, Ulysses Grant, Ellen W. Grant, and Jessie Grant. Graduate of U.S. Military Academy in West Point, New York in 1843. Served as brevet second lieutenant in the 4th U.S. Infantry in 1843, promoted to first lieutenant during the Mexican-American War, assigned to Oregon Territory in 1852. Promoted to captain in 1853 and resigned in April 1854. Farmer in White Haven, Missouri in 1855. Leather merchant in Galena, Illinois in 1860. Employed Emily Hodkins as a house servant in Galena, Illinois in 1860. Appointed colonel of the 21st Illinois Volunteers in 1861. Appointed brigadier general and commander of the District of Southeastern MIssouri in August 1861., Promoted to major general of volunteers in March 1862. Appointed lieutenant general and given command of all U.S. armies in March 1864. Accepted the surrender of Confederate General Robert E. Lee on April 9, 1865 in Appomattox Court House, Virginia. Appointed general-in-chief of the armies of the United States in 1866.
